title: Supervised Contrastive Learning from Weakly-Labeled Audio Segments for Musical Version Matching
author: Joan Serra (Sony AI), R. Oguz Araz (Music Technology Group, Universitat Pompeu Fabra), Dmitry Bogdanov (Music Technology Group, Universitat Pompeu Fabra), Yuki Mitsufuji (Sony Group Corporation), ...
relevance_why: This paper introduces a novel approach to weakly-supervised learning and contrastive loss tailored for audio analysis, which could enhance Haohe's research in audio generation and restoration contexts.
background: The task involves identifying different renditions of the same musical piece from weakly-labeled audio segments, focusing on segment-level matching rather than full tracks.
contribution: This paper introduces a method combining contrastive learning with weak audio supervision to improve version matching, achieving state-of-the-art results for both track and segment levels.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods primarily focused on full-track matching and leveraged traditional classification and triplet loss approaches, which do not efficiently handle segment-level mismatches.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work proposes new distance reduction strategies and a redesigned contrastive loss function that captures segment-level correlations without requiring segment-level annotations.

key_innovation: The innovative pairwise distance reduction strategies and a tailored contrastive loss effectively enable segment-based learning from weak annotations.
real_world_impact: Improves applications in music version detection and retrieval, enhancing musical discovery, copyright management, and supporting creativity in music generation.
limitations: No specific limitations are mentioned in the text.

new_terms.weakly-labeled: **Weakly-labeled** refers to data where annotations are only available at a coarse level (e.g., track level) instead of fine-grained data (e.g., segment level).
new_terms.contrastive loss: **Contrastive loss** is a loss function that encourages similar instances to be closer together in the embedding space while pushing apart dissimilar instances.

open_sourcing: Code and model checkpoints are shared in an anonymous GitHub link.
